definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: It has peculiar character comparing with other interferometers.
sentences.chinese: 与其它干涉仪相比，具有独特的优点。

sentences.english: The master bedroom of Room 318 had changed little since his stay 17 years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 318房的主卧室和他十七年前入住时相比变化不大。

sentences.english: Slipper dream compared to the people, Kate has overturned that idea.
sentences.chinese: 相比人们的水晶鞋梦，凯特却颠覆了这种观念。

sentences.english: In comparison with the Americans, Chinese are more sensitive about their face.
sentences.chinese: 和美国人相比，中国人非常重视他们的脸面。

sentences.english: However, the accumulative concentrations of DDT and BHC in 1998 was much higher than that of some foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 但1998年的蓄积水平与国外相比仍处于较高水平。

sentences.english: Mr Fukuda, by contrast, has a family legacy to enshrine.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，福田康夫有参拜神庙的家庭传统。

sentences.english: Compared with the TFP, the role of labor capital accumulation are more prominent.
sentences.chinese: 与TFP相比而言，劳均资本积累的作用更为突出。

sentences.english: Mr. Zhu has an advantage over Mr.
sentences.chinese: 相比魏先生，朱旭亮还有些“优势”。

sentences.english: The bursts have much more energy than the normal local variations in temperature.
sentences.chinese: 这样的爆发具备相比常规温变强大的多的能量。

sentences.english: It had significant difference compared with the lactic acid bacteria fermented soybean milk.
sentences.chinese: 与乳酸菌发酵豆乳相比，口感有明显的区别。

sentences.english: Is 0.76 inch really thin and compared to what?
sentences.chinese: 76英寸真的很薄吗，和什么相比呢？

sentences.english: Gambling revenues jumped 59% compared to the previous November.
sentences.chinese: 赌博业收入与去年同期相比激增了59%。

sentences.english: Do you feel you have the edge over McLaren here?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得在这里和迈克拉伦相比你更有优势吗？

sentences.english: And these findings are more favourable to Bush than more recent surveys.
sentences.chinese: 与很多近来调查相比，这些调查结果比较倾向于布什。

sentences.english: By contrast, unhappy people watched significantly more television in their spare time.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，不幸福的人业余时间很明显地多看电视。

sentences.english: Compared with other social insurances, maternity insurance has evident sexual characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 与其他社会保险相比，生育保险具有明显的性别特征。

definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
the corresponding time period (in a different year etc)/concurrent/synchronous
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
difference/to distinguish/to discriminate/to make a distinction/CL:個|个[ge4]
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
